                     <title>Aleksander Kulisiewicz collection M Research Materials Choral Radio Warszawa [Warsaw radio program] radio broadcast transcript.</title>
                  </titleInfo>
                  <abstract>Contains a typescript of the broadcast "Choral z Piekla Dna..."/Camp Songs broadcast by Polskie Radio i Telewizja.  Also contains two alternate typescript versions of the broadcast dated 1964. </abstract>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>United States Holocaust Memorial Museum</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/rps">Repository</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
               </mods>
            </objectXMLWrap>

resource.abstract: Contains a typescript of the broadcast "Choral z Piekla Dna..."/Camp Songs broadcast by Polskie Radio i Telewizja.  Also contains two alternate typescript versions of the broadcast dated 1964.

resource.source:
<objectXMLWrap>
               <mods xmlns="http://www.loc.gov/mods/v3">
                  <recordInfo>
                     <recordOrigin>WorldCat:122502894</recordOrigin>
                     <recordContentSource>ISIL:OCLC-LHM</recordContentSource>
                  </recordInfo>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Kulisiewicz, Aleksander.</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <titleInfo>
                     <title>Aleksander Kulisiewicz collection M Research Materials Nagrania inne [Various tape recordings] lists of songs program notes.</title>
                  </titleInfo>
                  <abstract>Contains information about lyricists, composers, and short genesis for several songs in Kulisiewicz's repertroire created for "Polskie Radio" in Warsaw as background material for a broadcast program that featured Kulisiewicz performing music from the camps.  Also contains an index of songs in Kulisiewicz's repertoire and those he performed on radio in Poland and abroad. </abstract>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>United States Holocaust Memorial Museum</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/rps">Repository</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
               </mods>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: Aleksander Kulisiewicz collection M Research Materials Nagrania inne [Various tape recordings] lists of songs program notes.
resource.abstract: Contains information about lyricists, composers, and short genesis for several songs in Kulisiewicz's repertroire created for "Polskie Radio" in Warsaw as background material for a broadcast program that featured Kulisiewicz performing music from the camps.  Also contains an index of songs in Kulisiewicz's repertoire and those he performed on radio in Poland and abroad.
resource.displayEntry: Kulisiewicz, Aleksander. Aleksander Kulisiewicz collection M Research Materials Nagrania inne [Various tape recordings] lists of songs program notes.

resource.source:
<objectXMLWrap>
               <did xmlns="urn:isbn:1-931666-22-9">
                  <unittitle>Maciej Józef Kwiatkowski papers </unittitle>
                  <unitdate>1944-1992</unitdate>
                  <unitid>92050</unitid>
                  <origination>
                     <persname>Kwiatkowski, Maciej Józef.</persname>
                  </origination>
                  <physdesc>
                     <extent>4 manuscript boxes </extent>
                     <extent>(1.6 linear feet)</extent>
                  </physdesc>
                  <repository>
                     <corpname>Hoover Institution Archives </corpname>
                     <address>
                        <addressline>Stanford, California 94305-6010</addressline>
                     </address>
                  </repository>
                  <abstract>Writings and radio broadcast transcripts, relating to the history of radio broadcasting in Poland, and especially to use of radio broadcasting by the Polish resistance movement during World War II. Includes copies of transcripts of radio broadcasts from Warsaw by the Polish resistance during the Warsaw uprising of 1944.</abstract>
                  <physloc>Hoover Institution Archives</physloc>
                  <langmaterial>
                     <language>English </language>
                     <language>Polish </language>
                  </langmaterial>
               </did>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: Maciej Józef Kwiatkowski papers 1944-1992
resource.abstract: Writings and radio broadcast transcripts, relating to the history of radio broadcasting in Poland, and especially to use of radio broadcasting by the Polish resistance movement during World War II. Includes copies of transcripts of radio broadcasts from Warsaw by the Polish resistance during the Warsaw uprising of 1944.

                  <recordInfo>

                  <name>

                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <titleInfo>
                     <title>Aleksander Kulisiewicz collection Records on microfilm Polish Radio - Katowice (1967-1968) - Correspondence correpsondence.</title>
                  </titleInfo>
                  <abstract>Contains correspondence concerning Teresa Laesserowa's program broadcast, "Choral z Piekla Dna" ("Songs from the Depths of Hell"); Mlodziez [Youth?], ZBOWID, Italian former prisoners -- concerning rebroadcast. </abstract>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>United States Holocaust Memorial Museum</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/rps">Repository</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
               </mods>
            </objectXMLWrap>

resource.abstract: Contains correspondence concerning Teresa Laesserowa's program broadcast, "Choral z Piekla Dna" ("Songs from the Depths of Hell"); Mlodziez [Youth?], ZBOWID, Italian former prisoners -- concerning rebroadcast.

resource.source:
Houghton Library, Harvard College Library, Harvard University b MS Slavic 14 Witkiewicz, Stanisław Ignacy, 1885-1939. Papers, 1928-1936 (bulk), 1928-1971 (inclusive). 1 box (.25 linear ft.)

Collection is in Polish with some printed materials in Dutch, English, French, and Italian.

Letters and other materials of Stanisław Ignacy Witkiewicz, the Polish painter, novelist, and playwright.
resource.title: Papers, 1928-1936 (bulk), 1928-1971 (inclusive).
resource.abstract: Letters and other materials of Stanisław Ignacy Witkiewicz, the Polishpainter, novelist, and playwright.
